name: Convert by Codex Solutions
title: Convert by Codex Solutions
description: How to integrate Convert with Make.com

children.text: Convert.com is a web-based A/B testing and experimentation platform focused on optimizing website and app conversion rates with advanced targeting, privacy compliance, and robust analytics. Integrating with Make.com enables automated workflows for experiment management, reporting, and personalized user experiences.
This is AI-generated content based on official Convert documentation. The content may still contain errors—please verify important information. If you have questions, contact
How to get support on Convert

Convert is a community-developed application and is subjected to the developer's terms and conditions, which may include applicable fees. Make does not maintain or support this integration. For assistance, please https://f.make.com/r/reachout?app_name=Convert&app_slug=convert-community&app_unique_id=convert-sgwsz6.
To use the Convert app in Make,
you must have an active account and an API Key or SDK Key,
To install this app, you need Admin, Owner, or App Developer permissions.
the on-screen instructions to complete the setup.
To get started, you must first create a connection between Convert and
, allowing the two services to communicate.
You can connect using the following method: API Key,Bearer Token.
You need to generate an API key and secret for your account.
Login to your platform using your credentials.
Navigate to the section where you can manage API keys for your account.
Choose the option to create a new API key.
Provide a name for the API key for identification purposes.
Optionally, specify the list of projects this API key should have access to, or leave blank to allow access to all projects.
Select the authentication type, either requestSigning or secretKey.
After creation, note the generated key_id and key_secret. The key_secret will only be shown at the time of creation and should be stored securely.
You need to generate an API key and secret for your account.
Login to your platform using your credentials.
Navigate to the API Keys section for your account.
Create a new API key by providing a name and optionally specifying the projects it should have access to.
Note the generated key_id and key_secret. These are required for Bearer Token authentication.
Some community developers require an additional specific
from the community developer's dashboard, generally found under
, add the Convert module to your
If you add a module with an instant tag, click
field, enter a name for the connection.
you copied from your Convert or follow the on-screen instructions to create the connection. You must also enter any required third-party API keys obtained earlier.
For detailed information on connecting an application, see
After connecting to the Convert app, you can choose from a list of available modules to build your

The "Account Addons" module allows you to manage and customize additional features or services linked to your account. With this module, you can easily add, view, or modify the extra options available for your account, helping you tailor your experience to better fit your needs.
The Aggregated Report module allows you to collect and summarize data from multiple sources, giving you a comprehensive overview in a single, easy-to-understand report.
Retrieves a detailed list of all available billing plans, including their features and pricing options.
The "Account Live Data" module lets you access and view real-time information about your account, such as current balances, recent activity, and other up-to-date account details.
Returns a list of experiences from your account, including details such as experience names, IDs, and other relevant information.
Retrieve detailed information about a specific account, such as its name, status, and other related attributes.
Retrieves detailed information about a specific project.
The "AccessRoles List" module retrieves a detailed list of all access roles available in your system, helping you view and manage user permissions more effectively.
The "Projects List" module retrieves a detailed list of all your projects, allowing you to view and manage the different projects within your account.
Retrieves a detailed list of all accounts connected to your service, allowing you to view and manage each account’s information easily.
You can look for more templates in
, where you'll find thousands of pre-created

customCSS:
<style>
@media print {
  html, body {
    overflow-x: visible;
  }
}
#tally-widget-button {
  position: fixed !important;
  background-color: #FFFFFF;
  display: none;
  visibility: visible !important;
  opacity: 1 !important;
  color: #0C121D;
  border: 2px solid #0C121D;
  border-radius: 4px;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: center;
  font-size: 14px;
  font-weight: 600;
  font-family: 'Inter';
  text-align: center;
  box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);
  cursor: pointer;
  z-index: 999999 !important;
  -webkit-tap-highlight-color: transparent;
  outline: none;
  touch-action: manipulation;
  pointer-events: auto;
  transform: translate3d(0, 0, 0);
}
.button-text {
  display: inline-block;
  margin-right: 8px;
}
.button-text::before {
  content: attr(data-text);
}
#tally-widget-popup {
  position: fixed;
  background-color: white;
  display: none;
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 10px 20px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4);
  z-index: 999999;
  overflow: hidden;
  border: 0px solid #0C121D;
  padding-top: 30px;
}
#tally-widget-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 10px;
  right: 10px;
  background: none;
  border: none;
  font-size: 36px;
  font-weight: bold;
  padding: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
  color: #0C121D;
}

  .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
    font-family: 'Inter' !important;
  }

  .dark .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #F6F6F6 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column > div > div > div.flex.flex-1.w-full.justify-center.pb-0 > div > div.flex.items-center.pl-0.pr-2.mb-5.xl\:-mt-1\.5 > div > div > div > div:nth-child(1) > div.flex.pr-2.text-gray-500.items-center {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  a.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-public-space-links-wrap .ab-public-space-link:first-of-type {
    border-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-toc-item-active a{
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 {
    text-decoration-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-left:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .ab-nav-left-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-right:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .ab-nav-right-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
#tally-inline-popup {
  position: fixed;
  display: none;
  z-index: 999999;
  width: min(420px, 90vw);
  height: min(550px, 80vh);
  background: #fff;
  color: #0c121d;
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.08);
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 12px 28px rgba(0,0,0,0.22), 0 2px 6px rgba(0,0,0,0.12);
  overflow: hidden;
  padding: 5px;
}

#tally-inline-popup iframe {
  width: 100%;
  height: 100%;
  border: 0;
  display: block;
  border-radius: 8px;
}

#tally-inline-popup .tip-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 6px;
  right: 8px;
  width: 32px;
  height: 32px;
  line-height: 28px;
  font-size: 22px;
  text-align: center;
  background: rgba(255,255,255,0.85);
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.06);
  border-radius: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
}

#main-column a[data-form-url],
#main-column a[data-tally-url] {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
  text-decoration: underline;
  text-underline-offset: 2px;
  text-decoration-thickness: 1.5px;
  font-weight: 600;
}

@media (max-width: 640px) {
  #tally-inline-popup {
    width: min(360px, 94vw);
    height: min(500px, 80vh);
  }
}

#main-column .ab-cta-button a.ab-cta-button {
  background-color: #7302D5;
}

/* Titles in purple */
.ab-link-blocks-wrapper .ab-link-block-item.ab-docs-card-mode .ab-link-block-content-wrap .font-bold {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
}

.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
}

</style>

reusableContentVariables.name: string
reusableContentVariables.description: a list or sequence of characters (like letters, numbers, and symbols) used to represent text in a computer programming.

reusableContentVariables.name: Operations
reusableContentVariables.description: An operation is a single module run to process data or check for new data.

reusableContentVariables.name: Credits
reusableContentVariables.description: Credits (formerly operations) are the currency for running scenarios.

reusableContentVariables.name: Route
reusableContentVariables.description: A route is a path that data can flow through in a scenario, visualized as the dotted lines between modules.
